Text: William Drayton Founder of Ashoka to speak this FridayNonPrivilegedpst You are cordially invited to The Fourth Annual Peterson Ethics Lecture Featuring William Drayton Founder of Ashoka an organization that supports social entrepreneurship This Friday October pm Wells Fargo Room Haas School of Business About William Drayton Drayton founded Ashoka in to use a venture capital model to support social entrepreneurs described by Ashoka as practical visionaries who are committed to social change The primary activity of the organization is identifying social entrepreneurs around the globe as candidates for Ashoka Fellowships which provide both financial and professional support To be chosen each prospective fellow goes through a rigorous search and selection process Fellows receive a living stipend typically for three years and they join the Global Fellowship a worldwide network of social entrepreneurs This year Paul Rice MBA was named an Ashoka Fellow for his work founding TransFair USA a nonprofit certification organization for Fair Trade products Since the organization has elected over Ashoka Fellows in countries Ashoka Fellows work in six areas learningeducation environment health human rights civic participation and economic development Approximately new fellows are elected each year by the Ashoka staff About the Peterson Ethics Lecture This annual lecture is sponsored the Peterson Program in Business Ethics funded by a gift from Rudolph Peterson BS president and CEO emeritus of BankAmerica Corporation Last year Treasury Secretary Paul H ONeill then director and chairman of Alcoa gave the lecture For more information on this years Peterson Ethics Lecture groupsnewspubshaasnewsarchiveshnhtmldrayton
